title: Good Code â€“ Power Workshop
keywords: kevlin henney workshop, good code workshop, clean code workshop
metaDescription: Intensive, practical course on good code writing techniques
description: This workshop will explore some common guidelines on what is considered good, from expression to subsystem, from naming to tests, from fluent to SOLID. Together, we will look at the consequences of good and not-so-good code from point of view of economics, day-to-day work, people and runtime performance and reliability.
audience: Developers, architects, technical leads, delivery leads
certification: Certificate of attendance will be issued by request.
language: The course is taught in English.

trainer.name: Kevlin Henney
trainer.title: Consultant, Trainer, Writer, Author of 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
